intro: Tetracera xui, commonly known as the Chinese tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Tetracera xui is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
